decks.notes: This deck aims to quickly assemble the Allosaurus Rider combo by using cards like Neoform and Eldritch Evolution to search for the pieces needed. The key concept revolves around sacrificing Allosaurus Rider to generate mana with Nourishing Shoal and then using that mana to cast huge creatures like Griselbrand or Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant. The deck also has ways to protect the combo with counterspells like Pact of Negation and Veil of Summer. Overall, the strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with big creatures and powerful effects while also having combo potential.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on utilizing cheap and efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls to quickly overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive playstyle. The deck also includes cards like Goblin Bombardment and Thraben Charm to deal direct damage to the opponent while maintaining board control. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah serves as a powerful finisher, while cards like Sacred Foundry and Arena of Glory provide mana fixing and additional utility. The deck aims to win quickly through efficient creature damage and burn spells.

The deck focuses on having a fast and aggressive approach, utilizing artifact cards and abilities to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By using cards like Mox Opal and Mishra's Bauble to generate mana and draw cards, along with powerful creatures like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Pinnacle Emissary, the deck aims to quickly establish a strong board presence and deal damage efficiently. The inclusion of disruptive spells like Tormod's Crypt and Galvanic Blast also helps to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy.

Utilizing the graveyard as a resource, this deck aims to quickly and efficiently reanimate powerful creatures like Griselbrand using cards like Goryo's Vengeance. It also includes disruptive elements like Force of Negation and Thoughtseize to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With card draw and filtering options like Faithful Mending and Ephemerate, along with control elements like Solitude and Teferi, Time Raveler, the deck can quickly assemble its combo pieces and disrupt the opponent, leading to a swift victory.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful spells, focusing on maximizing damage output and controlling the board. The deck utilizes a combination of efficient creatures like Territorial Kavu and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, along with Leyline of the Guildpact to boost their abilities. Consign to Memory and Leyline Binding provide removal options, while Stubborn Denial offers protection. Arena of Glory and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker add additional utility and ways to enhance your creatures. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain control throughout the game.

The deck focuses on quickly building a board presence through efficient creatures and utilizing various spells to disrupt the opponent and control the battlefield. It aims to apply pressure early on with aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and maintain that pressure through cards like Goblin Bombardment and Galvanic Discharge. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah to further enhance its aggressive strategy. By combining creature aggression with disruptive spells and strategic use of planeswalkers, the deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and utilizing burn spells to disrupt their game plan. The deck has a low mana curve, with cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls to put pressure on the opponent early on. Cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provide additional damage and board control. The deck also includes cards like Goblin Bombardment and Static Prison to disrupt the opponent's strategy and protect your own creatures.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on overwhelming opponents with a combination of powerful creatures and burn spells. By utilizing efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, alongside burn spells such as Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment, this deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Voice of Victory provide additional support and buffs for your creatures. The deck also includes utility lands like Marsh Flats and Arid Mesa, along with control elements like Elegant Parlor and Static Prison to disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures, using control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with big threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker while also having removal options like Kozilek's Return and Malevolent Rumble to deal with threats. The deck also includes card draw options like Sowing Mycospawn and Kozilek's Command to maintain resources. The inclusion of Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Boseiju, Who Endures provide additional ways to control the game and close out matches.

The main concept of the deck is to assemble the Broodscale Bloodchief combo using cards like Basking Broodscale, Glaring Fleshraker, and Malevolent Rumble to create a powerful synergy. The deck also utilizes Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End for additional threats. Cards like Ancient Stirrings and Urza's Saga help with card selection and finding key pieces of the combo. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of powerful creatures and synergistic spells, making it a formidable force in the Modern format.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with a mix of aggressive creatures and burn spells. The key strategy is to play creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls early on to apply pressure, while using cards like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to deal direct damage and control the board. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Arena of Glory provide additional support and potential finishing moves. The deck aims to maintain a fast pace and force opponents to react defensively, ultimately leading to victory through relentless aggression.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa, then using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to bring them back onto the battlefield for a game-winning combo. It also includes disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation to protect the combo and control the opponent's plays. The instant reanimation strategy is supported by cards like Solitude and Quantum Riddler, while Faithful Mending helps with card selection and graveyard filling. Overall, the deck aims to surprise the opponent with explosive plays and overwhelming threats.

This aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful creatures and using burn spells to deal direct damage to the opponent. The key strategy is to apply pressure early in the game with creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu, while using Lightning Bolt to control the board and finish off the opponent. Leyline of the Guildpact boosts the deck's synergy, allowing the player to efficiently cast their multi-colored spells. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creature aggression and direct damage spells.

The key concept of this combo - landless deck is to consistently disrupt the opponent while setting up the win condition using cards like Thundertrap Trainer, Fallaji Archaeologist, and Hydroelectric Specimen. By utilizing counterspells like Jwari Disruption and Disrupting Shoal, as well as removal like Suppression Ray and Sink into Stupor, the deck aims to control the game until it can assemble the Goblin Charbelcher combo with cards like Whir of Invention and Lotus Bloom. Waterlogged Teachings and Tameshi, Reality Architect provide additional utility and card advantage to help the deck stay ahead in the game.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble a powerful combo using cards that interact in a unique way without requiring any lands. By utilizing a combination of counterspells, tutors, and disruptive spells, the deck aims to control the game until it can play cards like Goblin Charbelcher or Lotus Bloom to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent. This landless combo deck relies on precise sequencing and strategic decision-making to outmaneuver opponents and win through unconventional means.

This deck focuses on quickly building a strong board presence by using low-cost spells and creatures that can deal damage efficiently. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of burn spells, aggressive creatures, and card advantage from effects like Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration. The strategy is to apply continuous pressure on the opponent and close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize. The deck's key strength lies in its ability to be proactive and push for a fast victory through efficient card selection and aggressive plays.
